meanings.sent1: She misanalyzes the data and reaches the wrong conclusion.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to misanalyze a situation when you are in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: He misanalyzes the recipe and ends up with a strange dish.
meanings.sent4: Don't misanalyze the map or you might get lost in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The detective's misanalysis of the evidence led to the wrong suspect being arrested.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake in analyzing something.
meanings.sent1: They misanalyze the experiment results and draw incorrect conclusions.
meanings.sent2: Students often misanalyze the text and misunderstand its meaning.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecaster misanalyzes the clouds and predicts rain on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: If you misanalyze the situation, you might miss out on a great opportunity.
meanings.sent5: Her tendency to misanalyze situations causes her unnecessary stress.
